alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 3:48PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Wichita and southeastern Greeley Counties through 315 PM MDT/415 PM CDT/... At 247 PM MDT/347 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southeast of Tribune, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph, nickel size hail and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flooding. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Wichita and southeastern Greeley Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
